detailed_info.name: Tea tree leaf oil
detailed_info.description: Melaleuca alternifolia, commonly known as tea tree, is a species of tree or tall shrub in the myrtle family, Myrtaceae. Endemic to Australia, it occurs in southeast Queensland and the north coast and adjacent ranges of New South Wales where it grows along streams and on swampy flats, and is often the dominant species where it occurs.

functions.name: Antioxidant
functions.description: Inhibits reactions favored by oxygen, thus avoiding oxidation and rancidity

functions.name: Skin conditioning - miscellaneous
